instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>   (need to clean ME  no manual for my Medusa )
threads.message: I have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> I need to clean the ME region.  I got my Medusa in and email requested the manual off my serial number but never got a replay.   Does anyone have or know how to set the Medusa to clean the ME?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>   (need to clean ME  no manual for my Medusa )
threads.message:
In the package should be one paper with download link.
Or maybe in the confirmation email of payment...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>   (need to clean ME  no manual for my Medusa )
threads.message: it's a email.   I sent it thursday and still have not got the manual.   I went ahead and sent another one.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>   (need to clean ME  no manual for my Medusa )
threads.message:
You didn't tell if version 2, or 3.
I sent you Medusa 2 manual, switch should be the same for both.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>   (need to clean ME  no manual for my Medusa )
threads.message:
I found the manual. Google mail threw it into spam. I have been playing with it for a few days now. Thing works good. It's a little touchy about reading the rooms but now that I learned it's quirks it works good. I got the level splitter so I am going to play with some T2 chip serial numbers. The keyboard is a little clunky but it is still faster than doing it with LBE.

I have version 3

Have you had success with serial numbers on T2 machines
